reviewText: My daughter first viewed copies from the library when she was 4.  She loved them so much, I had to buy them.  She watched each dozens of times and by 5 years old she knew so much about science that I could not keep up with her ;)

I've enjoyed watching it with him as well.

Why people think it's ok to terrorize children is beyond me! Many children watch television unsupervised and having an episode like this will do unnecessary harm. As for the other sterling episodes, they are wonderfully done.

Few weeks ago my son watched episode about Police patrol boat and later that week he spotted the same boat in our harbor. He started telling me about this boat, quoting the show's storytellers and drew attention of the officers on the boat. He got invited to check out the boat from the inside and even got to drive it around the harbor. Thanks to the officers and thanks to the show for great learning opportunities!

This series is a great educational tool for kids. The hosts explore a ton of different scientific subjects in a fun way that holds my sons interest while also teaching him about a wide range of topics. Within each episode there is some basic information as well as some pretty detailed science. My son started watching at about age 4 and some of the information was too complex for him, but I watched along with him and answered his questions and he learned a ton! I think older kids would be able to understand a lot more of the videos on their own, but would still come away with some unanswered questions which is great way to start learning more independently. We definitely did some internet searches after watching episodes to keep learning more.

It is worth noting that season 1 of this show was made almost 20 years ago, so some of the information is a bit dated. This didn't decrease my son's interest at all, but did mean that some information is no longer accurate. For example in one of the episodes they talk briefly about electric cars--which at the time were not available to consumers. Obviously now electric cars are fairly common. At one point they mention the planned mission for NASA to send astronauts to Mars in 2014 (I actually don't recall what year they said, but it's in the past). So be aware that any scientific advancements/changes since the taping of the show will not be included.
My kids really get enthralled in the show! Great teaching tool!

It's great and shows the inner workings of sewers and other factories. For a kid who is really info technical shows and how things work it's perfect! However, it was clearly made in the early 90s and my 3 year old found it a little boring.
Love this show. I wish there were more programs like it. Educational and fun for kids and adults!

This is my 8 year old daughter's favorite show to watch. The content is educational and she loves that it is hosted by kids. The only issue is that it is dated since they stopped filming in 2001. The Big Dig in Boston was finished in 2002 and it was being built when they filmed there.  My daughter also got very excited about the Stratosphere roller coaster in Las Vegas which closed in 2005.  Regardless, I still think it is a 5 star show with concepts that still work today. I think that I notice the issues with the timeliness of the content more than she does. Highly recommended!

It's amazing the opportunity these kids have with this show.. wish I had their job!!!  They keep it light and funny but very educational.  My biggest gripe is that they often go just shy of enough detail/explanation.  I'm often left with a lot of unanswered questions about the topic being covered. I realize it's a kids show so there is a fine line between too much and not enough ... they seem to fall a bit in the "not enough" side.

She's is six years old, but is advanced in science, and the material presented is challenging enough to keep her glued to the screen, but funny and entertaining as well. The kids that host the episodes are very engaging. I love that they cover such a broad array of topics in science, engineering, and technology.

But since mom and dad are watching with the kids, we plan to take those moments and make them teachable. We'll show them how to find more accurate, updated info.

Informative and interesting for the most part, though outdated in some content areas, and we didn't expect or appreciate the producers' decision to slip in provocative elements like a young woman in a tank top bumping around in slow motion on a roller coaster (obviously intentional because they showed it again in the closing credits of the segment), and the inclusion of a Playboy magazine in the recycling segment. Stuff like that is completely unnecessary and since PMK is a kids' show, it exposes the producers as kinda creepy. Hmmm, wonder which one of them gave those elements the green light....
We watched the first episode with children ages from 8-13. We all learned something,  a good break from just cartoons.
It is so Good For Grwing Childrens and very help full for them to motivate and grom them to come up with new things.

My 8 year old son really likes this show. We homeschool and it is an adjunct resource for his science lessons. It does spur conversation and he later repeats facts that he learned from recently viewed episodes. I am not sure if I would pay for it, but as a free item on Amazon Prime, I like it.

Our two and a half year old grandson is in a tool/trains/race car phase. He seems to be interested in all things mechanical. This series must be over his head, but it doesn't loose his interest, and he appears to be absorbing it like a sponge. It is a little light hearted, and has something for everyone.
My grandkids love it!  I enjoy watching it with them.  It's very educational and fun to watch.  Learning made fun!

It shipped very quickly and arrived without incident. The item was properly packaged as to not be damaged on its travels. We haven't opened it yet but it appears to be in the exact conditioned described. We are using it as part of our homeschool curriculum and was happy to see it available to us. If it is as informative as I hope it to be, we will be purchasing the other issues.

My child enjoyed the show very much.

We hope that more shows like this are available,  they are a great source of fun facts!

My great grand son has always been fascinated by heavy machinery---front-end loaders, back hoes, railroad trains, etc.  Since being introduced to PM for Kids by his mother, his interest has expanded, his vocabulary includes words and phrases I'd never expect a 5-year-old to use, and his comprehension of uses and applications of the machinery and techniques he views/hears amazes me.  What a wonderful development opportunity for youngsters----really YOUNG youngsters --- is PM for Kids
A little bit of over acting by the male juvenile , a bit advanced for 3.5 year old grandson. acceptable.

I am a special education teacher and use DVDs like this one, Bill Nye and The Magic School Bus to supplement my classroom lectures and LABS. I found these DVDs to be both educational and entertaining, and my student population enjoys them very much. They also cover the state standards and extended standards for my state (Ohio) for Physical, Life and Earth Science. I would recommend them to any (7-12 special education teacher) who wants to supplement their teaching. I think it is well worth the price! If it included an episode guide and teachers summary (like The Magic School Bus) I would give it 5 stars!
Great show for inquisitive children and adults.  Amazon has all the episodes with prime so there are hours of viewing. Good watching on a sick day to keep minds from becoming from mushy.
A little outdated, but my 5 yo daughter loves this show, good educational value! Not many educational show on prime, do enjoying this one.
My 4 yr old loves this. So happy all 4 season are included in PRIME. Very educational, fun and exciting
Awesome, and abundantly informative.  My kids thoroughly enjoyed every episode, and were captivated by the young and enthusiastic hosts.  Only one problem...the episodes are too short.
My 4 year old loves this show.  He learns about different math, science, and engineering concepts in a very fun way.
A great set of DVD's!  I gave it a 4 star rating instead of 5 only because the scenarios are somewhat dated, but the kids really enjoyed watching, and it kept their interest.
Wait I mean my KIDS love PMK...  Great show for kids of all ages and hey, I think it's pretty cool too!

Very Educational and reported by kids. I bought this for my grandchildren. My granddaughter and grandson are in school and thought this would be a great resource for when they need to write reports on subjects in school with 22 episodes on 5 disks, there is bound to be something of interest for them to learn about. I personally thought they were excellent and kept my attention even on subjects that really don't interest me.

My 11 year old daughter has LOVED this show since she was 5. It started when I came across a old 4 episode volume at a library sale and brought it home to her - she must have watched it 30 times in a row. Soon enough, my age 5 science buff was impressing dinner guests by explaining how dolphins use echolocation. Sadly, at that time, the whole series was not available on DVD, only certain episodes. We were ecstatic to find these complete sets on Amazon. The episodes cover a wide variety of topics that kids have questions about, and are rich with knowledge that applies to everyday life (for instance, did you know that polyester is made from recycled plastic?) Get this for the any and every child in your life, they will enjoy it for years to come. Also great for teachers - I have even used a couple of these in my high school science classes!
Educational for kids and they learn a lot especially if they love science and are adventures. Recommend for all kids

My 5 year-old daughter loves this show, can't get enough.  I think it's great for her age, not too overwhelmingly much information, but just right to be exposed to a variety of science topics.  Don't know how to rate it for older kids.
My kids ages 5,8 and 10 all enjoy these shows.  They keep it fun and the kids learn a lot!
My 7 yo LOVES this series. He has learned so much about how things work & already knows what he wants to enter in next years science fair.
What makes this show different is that its hosted by children, but its not watered down. My children love it.
My kid loves this show. I would rather him watch this then stupid sponge bob. Its a classic that I remember from my childhood.

I'm a third grader. It was very educational. Since I am a kid, in my language, I mean to say it was AWESOME! It was like a magician giving away the tricks, but in a good way. I used to do this program called Destination Imagination. This show would've been VERY helpful.

We can across this series through Amazon Prime! My 5 year old was hooked immediately and what he'd the entire 1st season on one of the snow days durning the polar vortex! It was entertaining, informative, and kept my son glued to the screen because he wanted to "learn more!"
Kids are loving it, they are watching for school work and learning science. They're having fun at the same time.

My daughter is seven and loves to watch this show.  We use it as a supplement science class.  The presentation is fun and exciting for young minds and she soaks up a variety of useful facts that will be very helpful as she gets older.  I love that she is expanding her knowledge, she loves that she gets to watch television!
My kids and I love this series and enjoy learning about many different subjects.  Offers a wide variety of subjects to choose from.
Interactive and fun. My son wanted me to give it 10 stars. You will learn and have fun while you are at it.
This is an excellent series for young minds that want to know how things work. It is getting harder to find programming like this.

My six year old grandson has watched several of these episodes, and found them quite interesting. It has to be for him to choose to watch this over Iron Man (cartoon) and other "kid" shows.

It doesn't just entertain, but teaches them how things in their real world work.

My son is 3 and half year old, he loves to watching it.
It is very good show to our family.
We enjoy watching together.
My son is very curious and mechanically minded and loves to know how things work. He just started watching this show last week and LOVES it!
My 6 yr old cannot get enough of "PMK" . I think he might be addicted to it after only a few days.
We have enjoyed the magazine for 70 or more years. The younger generation is sure to follow suit starting electronically.

These videos are so well done and not at all cheesy like some others I've seen.  My 5-year old son will sit for ages and watch one video after the next, then squirm with excitement to share what he's learned. These videos make being Amazon-Prime well worth the membership dues.
My 5 year old loves these! Very educational! Some of the content is for older kids but that is to be expected!
My 12 students, boys with special needs, first through third grade, ask daily for these videos during our transportation unit.

This show is entertaining and educational and completly family friendly for all ages.
I highly recomend it. it is also engaging enough for me to enjoy it with them.
We're using it to supplement our homeschool science routine and we ALL love it!  The Kids ask to watch PMFK.  Thank you for offering this on Prime!
My 5 and 7 year old are always asking to watch this series. It has an interesting array of topics and is educational.
My 5 and 8 years old couldn't get enough of it. Very educational and also fun. Packed with information to answer their daily questions of how and why
My grand children love this show, and I like it very much, too. It is both entertaining and educational, and something that youngsters and oldsters can enjoy watching together.
The kids will go to their room and just put it on to watch and enjoy. They wouldn't do that if they didn't like it. ;)
I love this show and love watching it with my son.  It always sparks questions from him and a desire to see how things work!
My 5 year-old loves the show and is learning a lot.  I highly recommend that you give it a try!

I have watched some episodes, but my children have watched more. They give it 5 stars because "the boy is silly", "the girl is always right", "they teach about animals", and "they recycled a pingpong ball". They visit lots of really cool places and introduce basic mechanical concepts and processes.
My kids, age 4 and 7, watched the first DVD straight through.  Great, educational show for almost any age group.
Four year old loves the car, building and emergency stories on this series!  I love that it is educational and truly holds his interest!
This program has some really interesting topics.  I was so glad that we found this series on prime.  Our grandson who is almost three loves watching the programs.
This program is made for pre teens, but interesting enough for adults.  There are many interesting topics to choose from!

All my kids ages 3 to 8 are wrapped up in this DVD which teaches them facts while entertaining them. It is fast-paced and features a group of kids that travels around learning about a variety of subjects. My boy who is most wrapped up in it is almost 5.

My kids LOVE this show! They watch it for homeschool science but most of the time just for fun :) The kids who host the show are fun and engaging, and the kids love the "Charlie's Tip" sections where Charlie teaches them how to make home made gum, "blood," rockets - all kinds of stuff! Great show.

Kids (3 and 5) were transfixed. Love the level of detail. They put work into this series. Submarine episode, for example, profiled many different types -- not just the basics. Quote from DD3 -- "I want to drive a submarine! I'm going to build a submarine... that can fly! Like an Archaeopteryx!" Okay, she's a little unclear on the concept. But the sub episode could rival -- and merge with! -- the flying dinosaur obsession. Thumbs up.

This is great! My 6 1/2 and 8 1/2 year old grandchildren are intrigued by this. They wouldn't want to watch it all the time like a favorite movie, but for a rainy day or those "We have a half hour, what can we do?" times, it's perfect. Even though this is the oldest of the series, the information is still useful and presented in a way that catches and holds their interest. And they're learning. Cool.
the kids love it! the kids love it! the dvd was still sealed! plays great! keeping my kids busy and i love it! thanks

I actually love the show, and so do my kids.  However, the streaming on this and other things has been awful the last few times we have tried to watch!  We are using an almost brand new, top quality HDMI cable, so that is not the problem.  Would love if the streaming did not stop several times per episode.

Popular Mechanics really makes these very educational as well as fun for the kids.  My son loves these Popular
Mechanics DVD's.
Great show my 6 year old son loves it & most of them are very educational.  I would highly recommend it.
The kids watch it over and over.  It is a hit in this house. They want another one like it for Christmas.
My kids love it and they learn a lot from watching it.  I most definitely recommend Popular Mechanics for Kids!
Very interesting, my children, aged 4 to 15 like these!  From Ben and Jerry's Ice Cream to Submarines.  A nice afternoon treat that I feel good about letting them watch.
These are excellent! My kids absolutely love them for long car rides. For the price it is unbeatable. Highly recommend.

My five year old son adores this series!  Not only is it fun, but it's also informative and very kid friendly.  I was afraid he might be bored after a bit because it wasn't "cartoonish" but he's not at all!
My boys love watching these episodes! They are educational and interesting. Something for everyone. Wish there were more TV shows like this!

PMK has great topics that intrigue kiddos and their parents, from sewers to weather and everything in between.  My son is 5 and he has watched every episode at least once.  We both especially love the segment where an at-home science experiment is demonstrated by the character named Charlie.  The experiments are doable and we've performed a few at home successfully.  Even though the series is 15 years old, it has held up well and is still relevant.

My kids (6 and 8) sit riveted to this show and then come away with all sorts of knowledge about how the world works. My 6 year old son told his teacher all about how cooking oil can fuel cars as bio fuel. They are so excited about this show and love every episode.
Good info.  My 5 year old likes it, but finds some of the episodes a little boring.  We just skip those and move on to the ones he likes.
This would have been a nice set for my boys to watch.  I ordered this twice and it would not play either time.
I teach 4th grade and the kids love watching this.  It's fun to watch and it teaches some important science concepts.

Gifted toddlers that are always thinking and are inquisitive like their 7 year old counterparts must see this. My  3 1/2 year old son is fascinated with this excellent series. Overall, I give it 5 stars !

My son is really enjoying this series.  His recent thirst to learn Physics has been entertained and continues to grow.  The children running the show are great in capturing his attention and keeping it.  It is very exciting to hear him apply the concepts in life.
This show is great for kids to learn about how things work. My kids love it. My kids actually ask to watch it and Im happy to oblige.

I watch this with my son and discuss what we are seeing together and while he learns about the many different topics, he's also entertained as the show has some fun/goofy bits and humor as they deliver the details about whatever the hosts are doing.

Some of the shows in this season are a bit less educational (race cars or toys) but those are still pretty fun to watch.

If your kid likes science or shows about how things work, this is a fine series to enjoy.

Also, given that watching all of the seasons on Prime is free...you can't go wrong!
This is a very informative, fast paced show that kids love!! It's very entertaining and the kids beg to watch it ;)
This is my 6yr old's favorite show now. Whenever he gets my Kindle he always starts watching PMK. Glad it is offered on Prime.

My five year old really likes watching these episodes....they were probably created over 10 years ago ( not exactly sure) but they are still very informative and very good.  We just watched the show about submarines last night.

This is a great series for kids and adult. My three year old loves the movies and know which episodes are on each disc. He actually sits and watches an entire disc, which is pretty amazing as he is a kid on the go! Good quality and very informative
I purchased this book for my 13 and 14 year old boys. The ordering process was simple,it worked well, and both boys enjoyed the book. Can recommend as a good option for young teenage boys.
My four year old son loves all of the Popular Mechanics For Kids videos and has learned quite a bit from them.

This 5 DVD set is a great value.  There are 22 episodes with a wide variety of topics.  My 7 year old loves this series.  His two favorites are the roller coaster and toy testing episodes.  He's even been inspired to request that we do some new science experiments based on the show.

Wish USA would produce more fine product like these from Canada...wow  kids love these  Adults will love that they are educational and entertaining...a hard balance....done beautifully  don't hesitate to buy  good product
The show provides information on all kinds of everyday things.  It is very entertaining and educational and it holds his attention easily.
A fantastic 'step-up' for our boy who enjoyed byt has outgrown all the 'Mightly Machines' type DVDs and was looking for something more engaging and informative - this is perfect.
My 5th grade students loved the episodes I showed to support our motion and design unit. I enjoyed them all.

My 4 1/2 year old likes these.  He doesn't ask for them like he does some of the other cartoons and such but when I do turn them on, he is interested and learns from them.  Bonus is that I really like them and learn from them too!!  He might be a little young for them but not so much that he loses interest immediately.
Can't say whether it will enthrall older kids the same way, but my almost 6 year old has watched andrewatched all of the episodes and tells me about things I didn't even know!

All of my children and their friends love watching these DVDs. I bought the original DVDs about 5 years ago and was very excited to see episodes that were only available on VHS are now available on DVD. Some of the shows are a little dated but the kids don't seem to mind.  They are scientific in a fun, easy to understand way. If your kids are interested in how things work, how things are made or science this is an excellent set to have. I keep them in my car for long trips and my kids have brought them to school for their teachers to show episodes to the class. Our favorites include "Radical Rockets" and the Aquarium episode. Best for ages 6 and up.
good  no problems

Very high quality educational show.  My 9 year old kept asking me how "everything" works.  This show is satisfying his curiosity about many different things from how our water is treated to how high rise buildings are built.  I highly recommend the show for all ages.  The rest of the family is learning right along with him.  It's very interesting.
Educational and my kids love it. Easy homeschool extra.
Our children love these programs.. they watch them over and over.. and retain a lot of knowledge..
Excellent show which pushes STEM education while being fun. Great for all ages.
My kids love it! And my husband and I find it interesting as well.
Excellent tool for home learning! Kids love it!
our son simply loves it and learns so much on a daily basis
These episodes are well done.  Entertaining for both children and adults.
This is a winner for all .
